intro: Corydalis casimiriana subsp. brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited poppy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, often pink or purple flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its short, rounded fruits, which set it apart from other members of the Corydalis genus. It typically grows in rocky or forested habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal. The plant is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
